Production.description: An object containing information about the production and its events.

identifier.description: The unique ID of this production. This could be an internal database ID, for example.

description.example: Hedwig, die Queen des Glamrock, kommt auf ihrer Tournee in Augsburg vorbei! Gemeinsam mit ihrer Band The Angry Inch gibt sie eines ihrer mitreißenden Konzerte. Zwischen den Songs, die – mal Rocknummer, mal Country-Ballade – von ihrem Leben und der Suche nach der eigenen Identität erzählen, kommt sie dem Publikum so nah wie nie.\nDiese Show sollten Sie nicht verpassen!

abstract.description: A short abstract or teaser text describing the production.
abstract.example: Das Kult-Rockmusical »Hedwig and the Angry Inch« wurde innerhalb weniger Jahre vom Off-Broadway-Geheimtipp zu einem Hit am Broadway selbst. 2023 erobert Hedwig, die »weltweit ignorierte Queen of Glamrock« endlich auch die Herzen des Augsburger Publikums – mit dem langjährigen Schauspiel-Ensemble-Mitglied Thomas Prazak in der Hauptrolle. Die Live-Musik steuern Stefan Leibold, Jonas Horche, Tilman Herpichböhm und Niklas Rehle als Band »The Angry Inch« bei.

events.description: A list of events at which this production will be performed.

genre.description: The genre of this production. Must use one of the pre-defined values.

accessModeSufficient.description: A list of single or combined accessModes that are sufficient to understand all the intellectual content of this production.

accessibilityHazard.description: A list of characteristics of the production that are physiologically dangerous to some users.

accessibilitySummary.description: A human-readable summary of specific accessibility features or deficiencies of the production.

inLanguage.description: Primary language of this production. Should contain a BCP 47 Language Tag.

creator.description:
List of people and organizations that contributed to the creation of this production, e.g. directors, stage designers, musical directors, etc.
If this production is a collaboration with another organization, e.g. another theater or orchestra, this organization should also be included
in this field.

If multiple people perform the same role/function (e.g. there is multiple directors),
each person should get their own entry in the `creator` array.

funder.description: A list of organization's that support this production through some kind of financial contribution.

sponsor.description: A list of organization's that support this production through a pledge, promise, or financial contribution.

Audience.description: Object describing the intended target audience of this production.

audienceType.description: A short textual description of the production's intended target audience.

identifier.description: The unique ID of this event. This could be an internal database ID, for example.

startDate.description: The start date and time of the event (in ISO 8601 date format).

endDate.description: The end date and time of the event (in ISO 8601 date format).

duration.description: The duration of the event in minutes.

intermission.description: The number of intermissions during this event. Set to 0 or omit this field, if there is no intermission during this event.

url.description: Link to further information about the event

subtitleLanguage.description: Language of the sub-/surtitles for this event, if any. Use the BCP 47 Language Tags.

location.description: The location of this event. An event can take place at one or more physical locations, one or more virtual locations, or both, if it's a hybrid event.

performer.description:
A list of people performing at the event, e.g. actors, dancers, etc.

If multiple people perform the same role on stage (e.g. there is multiple actors
performing the same character), each person should get their own entry in the `performer` array.

offers.description: A list of offers for this event, i.e. information about prices, tickets, etc.

eventStatus.description:
The status of this event.

- `EventScheduled`: The event is taking place or has taken place on the `startDate` as scheduled. Use of this value is optional, as it is assumed by default.
- `EventCancelled`: The event has been cancelled. Either `startDate` or `previousStartDate` may be used to specify the event's cancelled date(s).
- `EventMovedOnline`: Indicates that the event was changed to allow online participation.
- `EventPostponed`: The event has been postponed and no new date has been set. The event's `previousStartDate` should be set.
- `EventRescheduled`: The event has been rescheduled. The event's `previousStartDate` should be set to the old date and the `startDate` should be set to the event's new date.

previousStartDate.description: This field should contain the old `startDate`, if the `eventStatus` is either `EventPostponed` or `EventRescheduled`

name.description: A descriptive name for this offer, e.g. "Normalpreis", "Ermäßigt", "Preisgruppe A", usw.

minPrice.description: The minimum price of this offer.

maxPrice.description: The maximum price of this offer.

priceCurrency.description: The currency of the price. Use standard formats: TODO

roleName.description: The name of the role this person played in the creation of the production.

characterName.description: The name of the character performed on stage, if any.

@type.description: The type of this location object. Must be "Place" for physical locations.

wheelChairPlaces.description: Describes the presence of reserved spots for wheelchairs in the location, as defined by [a11yjson](https://sozialhelden.github.io/a11yjson/describing-objects/interfaces/#wheelchairplaces).

PostalAddress.description: The address of e.g. an organization or event location.

addressLocality.description: The locality in which the street address is, i.e. the city.

VirtualLocation.description:
If this event is taking place online (or both online and offline), a VirtualLocation specifies how to
participate in the online event.

@type.description: The type of this location object. Must be "VirtualLocation" for virtual locations.

url.description:
The virtual location's URL. This should be the link that is used to participate in the event
(e.g. a link to join an online meeting) or a link that lets the user sign up to attend the event.

description.description:
A description of the virtual location. This field can also be used to provide additional information
on how to attend this event.
description.example: Information on how to join the Online-Event will be provided two days before the event via e-mail.

WheelChairPlace.description: Describes the presence of reserved spots for wheelchairs, as defined by [a11yjson](https://sozialhelden.github.io/a11yjson/describing-objects/interfaces/#wheelchairplaces).

count.description: The number of designated places for wheelchairs in this location.

hasSpaceForAssistant.description: Is there additional space for an assistant?

wheelchairUserCapacity.description: The number of people using a wheelchair that can be accomodated at the same time. Use this when there is no designated space for wheelchair users, but the number is known.

logo.description: A link to the organization's logo.

version.description: The API version that is being used. MUST be the string "v2" for now.

organization.description: Information about the organization that is hosting and/or producing the events, i.e. the theater (group).

productions.description: A list of all current productions in the repertoire.
